comments:
if the user tries to set an existent file as destinationFolder, the method 
getSpecifiedContainer() doesn't check if it's a Folder or not and then throws 
an ClassCastException. 
 
No message is showed to explain that specified path is not valid (and why). 
 
 
The result of "Import ..."/"file system" into an existent file is: 
(stored inside the log)

The problem is that WizardImportResourcePage.getSpecifiedContainer has a slight
issue.
Right now if you specify a file that exists, it will cast it to an IContainer
which is the ClassCastException.  If you modify the code to check the resource
type, a null can be returned in the case of IFile.  However,
WizardImportResourcePage.validateDestinationGroup() will just see the null, and
see if the parent path is valid.  A similar yet different problem occurs later.
One could "fix" validateDestinationGroup() but that would just duplicate the
code that is already in getSpecifiedContainer.

Fixed - thanks for your help. We first need to check if the entry was a file 
and then invalidate the wizard finish if it was.
